summary: Crypto funds recorded $176 million in inflows, marking eight consecutive weeks of growth as their share of total crypto volume rises.
title: Crypto funds inflow streak continues, adding $176 million led by bitcoin, solana
content: Crypto fund inflows at asset managers such as CoinShares, Bitwise, Grayscale, ProShares and 21Shares added a further $176 million last week, marking eight consecutive weeks of growth, according to CoinShares’ latest report.

Last week’s addition brings year-to-date inflows to $1.32 billion at a time when ETP volumes now average 11% of total crypto volume compared to a long-term historical average of 3.4%, CoinShares' Head of Research James Butterfill wrote. Trading volumes now average $3 billion per week, double this year’s $1.5 billion weekly average.
However, despite the increased volume share, inflows remain well behind the $10.7 billion seen in 2021 and $6.6 billion in 2020, Butterfill noted.
Weekly crypto asset flows. Image: CoinShares.

Bitcoin BTC +1.31% investment products continued to dominate, adding $155 million of inflows to an eight-week streak that now represents 3.4% of assets under management — indicating positive sentiment in anticipation of approval for a spot-based bitcoin ETF in the U.S., Butterfill said. Short bitcoin products, on the other hand, registered outflows of $8.5 million.

Solana SOL +3.41% led the altcoin-based crypto funds last week, adding inflows of $13.6 million. Ether and avalanche investment products brought in $3.3 million and $1.8 million, respectively. Uniswap and polygon funds saw minor outflows.
Regionally, Canada, Germany and Switzerland led the inflows with $98 million, $63 million and $35 million, respectively. In contrast, the U.S. registered outflows totaling $19 million.
